Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: METHODS : The effect of pretreatment with trazodone on dexamphetamine - and apomorphine - induced oral stereotypies , on catalepsy induced by haloperidol and apomorphine ( 0 . 05 mg / kg , i . p . ) , on ergometrine - induced wet dog shake ( WDS ) behavior and fluoxetine - induced penile erections was studied in rats .

Let's think step by step.

| Disease |
| --- |
| dexamphetamine-induced oral stereotypies |
| apomorphine-induced oral stereotypies |
| catalepsy induced by haloperidol and apomorphine (0.05 mg/kg, i.p.) |
| ergometrine-induced wet dog shake (WDS) behavior |
| fluoxetine-induced penile erections |

The "Disease" entities in the paragraph are:

* dexamphetamine-induced oral stereotypies
* apomorphine-induced oral stereotypies
* catalepsy induced by haloperidol and apomorphine (0.05 mg/kg, i.p.)
* ergometrine-induced wet dog shake (WDS) behavior
* fluoxetine-induced penile erections

These entities are described as the effects of various substances on the behavior or physiology of rats. They are not necessarily diseases in the traditional sense, but they are considered as such in the context of this study.

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Disease |
| --- |
| catalepsy induced by haloperidol and apomorphine (0.05 mg/kg, i.p.) |

The only clear "Disease" entity in the paragraph is:

* catalepsy induced by haloperidol and apomorphine (0.05 mg/kg, i.p.)

The other entities mentioned in the paragraph are not clearly diseases, but rather behaviors or physiological responses induced by various substances. They are not considered diseases in the traditional sense, and are not included in the table.
